Package com.example.eventlottery

Class OrganizerEventInfoFragmentTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.eventlottery.OrganizerEventInfoFragmentTest
public class OrganizerEventInfoFragmentTest extends Object
Unit tests for OrganizerEventInfoFragment Tests business logic for recipient count formatting and user data processing

    setUp()
    Sets up test fixtures before each test method Creates test users with various FCM token states

    testCalculateAllCounts_AllEmpty()
    Tests calculating all counts when all lists are empty Verifies all counts are 0 when no entrants exist in any category

    Tests calculating all three counts simultaneously from a complete event document Verifies all counts are calculated correctly from a realistic data structure

    Tests calculating cancelled count with empty cancelledEntrants list Verifies count is 0 when list exists but is empty

    Tests calculating cancelled count when cancelledEntrants is null Verifies count defaults to 0 when no cancelled users exist

    Tests calculating cancelled count from cancelledEntrants array Verifies count is calculated correctly from list of cancelled user IDs

    Tests calculating waitlist count when waitlistedUsers is null Verifies count defaults to 0 when waitlist exists but has no users

    Tests calculating waitlist count from Firestore snapshot data structure Verifies count is calculated correctly from nested waitlist/waitlistedUsers structure

    Tests converting a list of user IDs to user data map format Verifies the conversion creates proper Map structure with "id" key
    void
    testConvertUserIdsToUserData_EmptyList()
    Tests converting empty user ID list Verifies empty input produces empty output
    void
    testCountUsersWithAndWithoutTokens()
    Tests counting users in a mixed list Verifies accurate counting of total users vs users with tokens
    void
    testExtractUserIdFromDataMap()
    Tests extracting user ID from user data map Verifies that the "id" key can be retrieved from the map structure
    void
    testExtractUserIdFromDataMap_MissingId()
    Tests handling of user data map with missing ID Verifies null is returned when "id" key is not present
    void
    testFilterUsersWithFCMTokens()
    Tests that users with valid FCM tokens are correctly identified Verifies the filtering logic that checks for non-null and non-empty tokens
    void
    testFilterUsersWithFCMTokens_AllValid()
    Tests filtering when all users have valid FCM tokens Verifies no users are filtered out when all have tokens
    void
    testFilterUsersWithFCMTokens_EmptyList()
    Tests filtering with an empty user list Verifies empty input produces empty output
    void
    testFilterUsersWithFCMTokens_NoneValid()
    Tests filtering when no users have valid FCM tokens Verifies all users are filtered out when none have tokens
    void
    testRecipientCount_LargeNumber()
    Tests recipient count formatting with large number Verifies the format works with larger counts
    void
    testRecipientCount_MultipleRecipients()
    Tests that recipient count text is formatted correctly for multiple recipients Verifies plural "recipients" is used when count is greater than 1
    void
    testRecipientCount_SingleRecipient()
    Tests that recipient count text is formatted correctly for a single recipient Verifies singular "recipient" is used when count is 1
    void
    testRecipientCount_ZeroRecipients()
    Tests recipient count formatting with zero recipients Verifies plural form is used for zero count
    void
    testUserCanReceiveNotifications()
    Tests that User's canReceiveNotifications method works correctly Verifies the method returns true only for users with valid FCM tokens
    void
    testUserDataIntegrityDuringFiltering()
    Tests that user data structure is preserved during conversion Verifies all user information remains intact after list operations
    void
    testUserFCMToken_SetAndGet()
    Tests that FCM token can be set and retrieved correctly Verifies the getter and setter work as expected
    void
    testUserFCMToken_UpdateFromNull()
    Tests updating user FCM token from null to valid Verifies user can transition from having no token to having one
